text:
Champions League
Bayern Munich - Olympiakos: Lewandowski qualifies Munich
Bayern Munich struggled to win against Olympiakos in the Champions League and, once again, relied on its serial striker Robert Lewandowski.
06 Nov 2019, 19:46 by Antoine Chirat



Fiete ArpClub previous: Hamburg Indemnity: 3 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Ivan Perisic Club previous: Inter MilanIndemnity: 5 M ‚Ç¨ (loan) Icon Sport



Philippe CoutinhoClub previous: FC BarcelonaCompensation: ‚Ç¨ 8.5m (loan) Icon Sport



Micka√´l CuisanceClub previous: Borussia M√∂nchengladbachCompensation: 12 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Benjamin PavardClub previous: VfB StuttgartCompensation: 35 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Lucas HernandezClub previous: Atl√©tico MadridPayment: 80 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport

Bayern Munich: All the rookies of the transfer window 2019




A concern ? Call Lewandowski! Badly placed against Olympiakos in the Champions League a few days after the departure of his coach Niko Kovac, Bayern Munich had to win to revive the Munich machine and prepare the best Sunday's clash against Dortmund, and as often, the inevitable Robert Lewandowski did the job. Scorer in the 79th of the match, he offers success and qualification to his team that could blow late in the game with a second performance of Perisic just entered the game. The Bavarians can now focus on the "Klassiker" of this weekend against the enemy of always, Borussia Dortmund.
